title: Calories in a Fried Plantain
meta_description: Discover calories in a fried plantain, including carbs, fat, protein, and full nutrition breakdown per slice with easy tweaks and FAQs.
assumptions: Medium ripe plantain slice (~50 g), deep-fried in vegetable oil, no added salt or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by plantain ripeness, slice size, oil type/absorption, and frying method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One medium fried plantain slice has ~120 kcal, mostly from carbs and absorbed oil.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a fried plantain slice?
faqs.a: About 120 kcal for one medium slice.

faqs.q: Are fried plantains high in carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, ~18 g carbs per slice, mainly from the starchy plantain.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in a fried plantain?
faqs.a: Around 6 g total fat, mostly from frying oil.
Very little, only ~0.5 g per slice.

faqs.q: How does ripeness affect calories in fried plantains?
faqs.a: Riper plantains are sweeter with similar calories; greener ones are starchier but fry similarly.
